sentences.zh: 晉唐叔虞者，周武王子而成王弟。

translations.text: Tang Shu Yu of Jin was the son of King Wu of Zhou and younger brother of King Cheng.

sentences.zh: 初，武王與叔虞母會時，夢天謂武王曰：「余命女生子，名虞，余與之唐。」

translations.text: Once, when King Wu's wife was pregnant with Shu Yu, she dreamed that Heaven told King Wu: 'I command you to give birth to a son named Yu, and I grant him Tang.'

sentences.zh: 及生子，文在其手曰「虞」，故遂因命之曰虞。

translations.text: When the child was born, the character 'Yu' was written on his hand, so they named him Yu as the dream had commanded.

Tang Shu Yu of Jin was the son of King Wu of Zhou and younger brother of King Cheng. Once, when King Wu's wife was pregnant with Shu Yu, she dreamed that Heaven told King Wu: 'I command you to give birth to a son named Yu, and I grant him Tang.' When the child was born, the character 'Yu' was written on his hand, so they named him Yu as the dream had commanded.

sentences.zh: 武王崩，成王立，唐有亂，周公誅滅唐。

translations.text: When King Wu died and King Cheng ascended the throne, Tang rebelled, so the Duke of Zhou executed and extinguished the Tang state.

sentences.zh: 成王與叔虞戲，削桐葉為珪以與叔虞，曰：「以此封若。」

translations.text: King Cheng was playing with Shu Yu and cut a paulownia leaf into the shape of a jade tablet, saying: 'With this I enfeoff you.'

sentences.zh: 史佚因請擇日立叔虞。

translations.text: Shi Yi therefore requested that they choose an auspicious day to establish Shu Yu as ruler.

sentences.zh: 成王曰：「吾與之戲耳。」

translations.text: King Cheng said: 'I was only playing with him.'

sentences.zh: 史佚曰：「天子無戲言。

translations.text: Shi Yi replied: 'The Son of Heaven does not make frivolous statements.

sentences.zh: 言則史書之，禮成之，樂歌之。」

translations.text: Whatever he says gets recorded by the historians, formalized by ritual, and celebrated in music.'

sentences.zh: 於是遂封叔虞於唐。

translations.text: Thus Shu Yu was enfeoffed at Tang.

sentences.zh: 唐在河、汾之東，方百里，故曰唐叔虞。

translations.text: Tang was located east of the Yellow River and Fen River, covering a square area of one hundred li, which is why he was called Tang Shu Yu.

sentences.zh: 姓姬氏，字子于。

translations.text: He belonged to the Ji clan and was styled Zi Yu.

When King Wu died and King Cheng ascended the throne, Tang rebelled, so the Duke of Zhou executed and extinguished the Tang state. King Cheng was playing with Shu Yu and cut a paulownia leaf into the shape of a jade tablet, saying: 'With this I enfeoff you.' Shi Yi therefore requested that they choose an auspicious day to establish Shu Yu as ruler. King Cheng said: 'I was only playing with him.' Shi Yi replied: 'The Son of Heaven does not make frivolous statements. Whatever he says gets recorded by the historians, formalized by ritual, and celebrated in music.' Thus Shu Yu was enfeoffed at Tang. Tang was located east of the Yellow River and Fen River, covering a square area of one hundred li, which is why he was called Tang Shu Yu. He belonged to the Ji clan and was styled Zi Yu.

sentences.zh: 唐叔子燮，是為晉侯。

translations.text: Tang Shu's son was Xie, who became the Marquis of Jin.

sentences.zh: 晉侯子寧族，是為武侯。

translations.text: The Marquis of Jin's son was Ning Zu, who became Marquis Wu.

sentences.zh: 武侯之子服人，是為成侯。

translations.text: Marquis Wu's son was Fu Ren, who became Marquis Cheng.

sentences.zh: 成侯子福，是為厲侯。

translations.text: Marquis Cheng's son was Fu, who became Marquis Li.

sentences.zh: 厲侯之子宜臼，是為靖侯。

translations.text: Marquis Li's son was Yi Jiu, who became Marquis Jing.

sentences.zh: 靖侯已來，年紀可推。

translations.text: From Marquis Jing onward, the chronology can be reconstructed.

sentences.zh: 自唐叔至靖侯五世，無其年數。

translations.text: From Tang Shu to Marquis Jing was five generations, but no specific years are recorded for them.

Tang Shu's son was Xie, who became the Marquis of Jin. The Marquis of Jin's son was Ning Zu, who became Marquis Wu. Marquis Wu's son was Fu Ren, who became Marquis Cheng. Marquis Cheng's son was Fu, who became Marquis Li. Marquis Li's son was Yi Jiu, who became Marquis Jing. From Marquis Jing onward, the chronology can be reconstructed. From Tang Shu to Marquis Jing was five generations, but no specific years are recorded for them.

sentences.zh: 靖侯十七年，周厲王迷惑暴虐，國人作亂，厲王出奔于彘，大臣行政，故曰「共和」。

translations.text: In the seventeenth year of Marquis Jing's reign, King Li of Zhou was confused and tyrannical, so the people rose up in rebellion, King Li fled to Zhi, and the ministers administered the government, which was called the 'Republican' period.

In the seventeenth year of Marquis Jing's reign, King Li of Zhou was confused and tyrannical, so the people rose up in rebellion, King Li fled to Zhi, and the ministers administered the government, which was called the 'Republican' period.

sentences.zh: 十八年，靖侯卒，子釐侯司徒立。

translations.text: In the eighteenth year, Marquis Jing died, and his son Xi Hou Si Tu ascended the throne.

sentences.zh: 釐侯十四年，周宣王初立。

translations.text: In the fourteenth year of Xi Hou's reign, King Xuan of Zhou ascended the throne.

sentences.zh: 十八年，釐侯卒，子獻侯籍立。

translations.text: In the eighteenth year, Xi Hou died, and his son Xian Hou Ji ascended the throne.

sentences.zh: 獻侯十一年卒，子穆侯費王立。

translations.text: In the eleventh year, Xian Hou died, and his son Mu Hou Fei Wang ascended the throne.

In the eighteenth year, Marquis Jing died, and his son Xi Hou Si Tu ascended the throne. In the fourteenth year of Xi Hou's reign, King Xuan of Zhou ascended the throne. In the eighteenth year, Xi Hou died, and his son Xian Hou Ji ascended the throne. In the eleventh year, Xian Hou died, and his son Mu Hou Fei Wang ascended the throne.

sentences.zh: 穆侯四年，取齊女姜氏為夫人。

translations.text: In the fourth year of Mu Hou's reign, he took a daughter of the Jiang clan from Qi as his wife.

sentences.zh: 七年，伐條。

translations.text: In the seventh year, he attacked the state of Tiao.

sentences.zh: 生太子仇。

translations.text: He fathered the crown prince Qiu.

sentences.zh: 十年，伐千畝，有功。

translations.text: In the tenth year, he attacked Qian Mu and achieved merit.

sentences.zh: 生少子，名曰成師。

translations.text: He fathered a younger son named Cheng Shi.

sentences.zh: 晉人師服曰：「異哉，君之命子也！

translations.text: The Jin official Shi Fu said: 'How ominous! The lord names his sons this way!

sentences.zh: 太子曰仇，仇者讎也。

translations.text: The crown prince is named Qiu, which means enemy.

sentences.zh: 少子曰成師，成師大號，成之者也。

translations.text: The younger son is named Cheng Shi, which means one who completes it - a great title.

sentences.zh: 名自命也；

translations.text: Names are self-fulfilling prophecies;

sentences.zh: 物自定也。

translations.text: things determine their own nature.

sentences.zh: 今適庶名反逆，此後晉其能毋亂乎？」

translations.text: Now the legitimate and illegitimate sons have names that contradict each other - this bodes ill for Jin's future, for there will surely be no peace.'

In the fourth year of Mu Hou's reign, he took a daughter of the Jiang clan from Qi as his wife. In the seventh year, he attacked the state of Tiao. He fathered the crown prince Qiu. In the tenth year, he attacked Qian Mu and achieved merit. He fathered a younger son named Cheng Shi. The Jin official Shi Fu said: 'How ominous! The lord names his sons this way! The crown prince is named Qiu, which means enemy. The younger son is named Cheng Shi, which means one who completes it - a great title. Names are self-fulfilling prophecies; things determine their own nature. Now the legitimate and illegitimate sons have names that contradict each other - this bodes ill for Jin's future, for there will surely be no peace.'

sentences.zh: 二十七年，穆侯卒，弟殤叔自立，太子仇出奔。

translations.text: In the twenty-seventh year, Mu Hou died, and his younger brother Shang Shu usurped the throne, while Crown Prince Qiu fled into exile.

sentences.zh: 殤叔三年，周宣王崩。

translations.text: In the third year of Shang Shu's reign, King Xuan of Zhou died.

sentences.zh: 四年，穆侯太子仇率其徒襲殤叔而立，是為文侯。

translations.text: In the fourth year, Mu Hou's Crown Prince Qiu led his followers, attacked Shang Shu, and ascended the throne as Wen Hou.

In the twenty-seventh year, Mu Hou died, and his younger brother Shang Shu usurped the throne, while Crown Prince Qiu fled into exile. In the third year of Shang Shu's reign, King Xuan of Zhou died. In the fourth year, Mu Hou's Crown Prince Qiu led his followers, attacked Shang Shu, and ascended the throne as Wen Hou.

sentences.zh: 文侯十年，周幽王無道，犬戎殺幽王，周東徙。

translations.text: In the tenth year of Wen Hou's reign, King You of Zhou was without virtue, the Quanrong killed King You, and Zhou moved eastward.

sentences.zh: 而秦襄公始列為諸侯。

translations.text: Qin Xiang Gong began to be ranked among the feudal lords.
In the tenth year of Wen Hou's reign, King You of Zhou was without virtue, the Quanrong killed King You, and Zhou moved eastward. Qin Xiang Gong began to be ranked among the feudal lords.

sentences.zh: 三十五年，文侯仇卒，子昭侯伯立。

translations.text: In the thirty-fifth year, Wen Hou Qiu died, and his son Zhao Hou Bo ascended the throne.
In the thirty-fifth year, Wen Hou Qiu died, and his son Zhao Hou Bo ascended the throne.

sentences.zh: 昭侯元年，封文侯弟成師于曲沃。

translations.text: In the first year of Zhao Hou's reign, he enfeoffed Wen Hou's younger brother Cheng Shi at Quwo.

sentences.zh: 曲沃邑大於翼。

translations.text: The city of Quwo was larger than Yi.

sentences.zh: 翼，晉君都邑也。

translations.text: Yi was the capital city of the Jin lord.

sentences.zh: 成師封曲沃，號為桓叔。

translations.text: Cheng Shi was enfeoffed at Quwo with the title of Huan Shu.

sentences.zh: 靖侯庶孫欒賓相桓叔。

translations.text: Jing Hou's concubine-born grandson Luan Bin assisted Huan Shu.

sentences.zh: 桓叔是時年五十八矣，好德，晉國之眾皆附焉。

translations.text: At this time, Huan Shu was fifty-eight years old, virtuous in nature, and all the people of Jin attached themselves to him.

sentences.zh: 君子曰：「晉之亂其在曲沃矣。

translations.text: The gentleman said: 'The disorder in Jin will arise from Quwo.

sentences.zh: 末大於本而得民心，不亂何待！」

translations.text: When the branch becomes larger than the root and wins the people's hearts, disorder is inevitable.'

In the first year of Zhao Hou's reign, he enfeoffed Wen Hou's younger brother Cheng Shi at Quwo. The city of Quwo was larger than Yi. Yi was the capital city of the Jin lord. Cheng Shi was enfeoffed at Quwo with the title of Huan Shu. Jing Hou's concubine-born grandson Luan Bin assisted Huan Shu. At this time, Huan Shu was fifty-eight years old, virtuous in nature, and all the people of Jin attached themselves to him. The gentleman said: 'The disorder in Jin will arise from Quwo. When the branch becomes larger than the root and wins the people's hearts, disorder is inevitable.'

sentences.zh: 七年，晉大臣潘父弒其君昭侯而迎曲沃桓叔。

translations.text: In the seventh year, the Jin minister Pan Fu assassinated his lord Zhao Hou and welcomed Huan Shu of Quwo.

sentences.zh: 桓叔欲入晉，晉人發兵攻桓叔。

translations.text: Huan Shu wished to enter Jin, so the Jin people sent troops to attack him.

sentences.zh: 桓叔敗，還歸曲沃。

translations.text: Huan Shu was defeated and returned to Quwo.

sentences.zh: 晉人共立昭侯子平為君，是為孝侯。

translations.text: The Jin people together established Zhao Hou's son Ping as lord, who was called Xiao Hou.

sentences.zh: 誅潘父。

translations.text: They executed Pan Fu.

In the seventh year, the Jin minister Pan Fu assassinated his lord Zhao Hou and welcomed Huan Shu of Quwo. Huan Shu wished to enter Jin, so the Jin people sent troops to attack him. Huan Shu was defeated and returned to Quwo. The Jin people together established Zhao Hou's son Ping as lord, who was called Xiao Hou. They executed Pan Fu.

sentences.zh: 孝侯八年，曲沃桓叔卒，子胛桓叔，是為曲沃莊伯。

translations.text: In Xiao Hou's eighth year, Huan Shu of Quwo died, and his son Jia succeeded him as Huan Shu, who was called Zhuang Bo of Quwo.

sentences.zh: 孝侯十五年，曲沃莊伯弒其君晉孝侯于翼。

translations.text: In Xiao Hou's fifteenth year, Zhuang Bo of Quwo assassinated his lord Xiao Hou of Jin at Yi.

sentences.zh: 晉人攻曲沃莊伯，莊伯復入曲沃。

translations.text: The Jin people attacked Zhuang Bo of Quwo, but Zhuang Bo retreated back into Quwo.

sentences.zh: 晉人復立孝侯子郄為君，是為鄂侯。

translations.text: The Jin people again established Xiao Hou's son Xi as lord, who was called E Hou.

In Xiao Hou's eighth year, Huan Shu of Quwo died, and his son Jia succeeded him as Huan Shu, who was called Zhuang Bo of Quwo. In Xiao Hou's fifteenth year, Zhuang Bo of Quwo assassinated his lord Xiao Hou of Jin at Yi. The Jin people attacked Zhuang Bo of Quwo, but Zhuang Bo retreated back into Quwo. The Jin people again established Xiao Hou's son Xi as lord, who was called E Hou.

sentences.zh: 鄂侯六年卒。

translations.text: E Hou died in his sixth year.

sentences.zh: 曲沃莊伯聞晉鄂侯卒，乃興兵伐晉。

translations.text: When E Hou died, Zhuang Bo of Quwo raised troops and attacked Jin.

sentences.zh: 周平王使虢公將兵伐曲沃莊伯，莊伯走保曲沃。

translations.text: King Ping of Zhou sent the Marquis of Guo to lead troops against Zhuang Bo of Quwo, but Zhuang Bo fled and defended Quwo.

sentences.zh: 晉人共立鄂侯子光，是為哀侯。

translations.text: The Jin people together established E Hou's son Guang as lord, who was called Ai Hou.

E Hou died in his sixth year. When E Hou died, Zhuang Bo of Quwo raised troops and attacked Jin. King Ping of Zhou sent the Marquis of Guo to lead troops against Zhuang Bo of Quwo, but Zhuang Bo fled and defended Quwo. The Jin people together established E Hou's son Guang as lord, who was called Ai Hou.

sentences.zh: 哀侯二年曲沃莊伯卒，子稱代莊伯立，是為曲沃武公。

translations.text: In Ai Hou's second year, Zhuang Bo of Quwo died, and his son Cheng succeeded him as Wu Gong of Quwo.

sentences.zh: 哀侯六年，魯弒其君隱公。

translations.text: In Ai Hou's sixth year, Lu assassinated its lord Duke Yin.

sentences.zh: 哀侯八年，晉侵陘廷。

translations.text: In Ai Hou's eighth year, Jin invaded Xing Ting.

sentences.zh: 陘廷與曲沃武公謀，九年，伐晉于汾旁，虜哀侯。

translations.text: Xing Ting plotted with Wu Gong of Quwo, and in the ninth year they attacked Jin at the Fen River crossing, capturing Ai Hou.

sentences.zh: 晉人乃立哀侯子小子為君，是為小子侯。

translations.text: The Jin people then established Ai Hou's son Xiao Zi as lord, who was called Xiao Zi Hou.

In Ai Hou's second year, Zhuang Bo of Quwo died, and his son Cheng succeeded him as Wu Gong of Quwo. In Ai Hou's sixth year, Lu assassinated its lord Duke Yin. In Ai Hou's eighth year, Jin invaded Xing Ting. Xing Ting plotted with Wu Gong of Quwo, and in the ninth year they attacked Jin at the Fen River crossing, capturing Ai Hou. The Jin people then established Ai Hou's son Xiao Zi as lord, who was called Xiao Zi Hou.

sentences.zh: 小子元年，曲沃武公使韓萬殺所虜晉哀侯。

translations.text: In Xiao Zi Hou's first year, Wu Gong of Quwo sent Han Wan to kill the captive Ai Hou.

sentences.zh: 曲沃益彊，晉無如之何。

translations.text: Quwo grew increasingly strong, and Jin could do nothing about it.
In Xiao Zi Hou's first year, Wu Gong of Quwo sent Han Wan to kill the captive Ai Hou. Quwo grew increasingly strong, and Jin could do nothing about it.

sentences.zh: 晉小子之四年，曲沃武公誘召晉小子殺之。

translations.text: In Xiao Zi Hou's fourth year, Wu Gong of Quwo lured and summoned Xiao Zi Hou, then killed him.

sentences.zh: 周桓王使虢仲伐曲沃武公，武公入于曲沃，乃立晉哀侯弟緡為晉侯。

translations.text: King Huan of Zhou sent Guo Zhong to attack Wu Gong of Quwo, but Wu Gong entered Quwo, so they established Jin Ai Hou's younger brother Min as the Jin lord.

In Xiao Zi Hou's fourth year, Wu Gong of Quwo lured and summoned Xiao Zi Hou, then killed him. King Huan of Zhou sent Guo Zhong to attack Wu Gong of Quwo, but Wu Gong entered Quwo, so they established Jin Ai Hou's younger brother Min as the Jin lord.

sentences.zh: 晉侯緡四年，宋執鄭祭仲而立突為鄭君。

translations.text: In Jin Hou Min's fourth year, Song seized Ji Zhong of Zheng and established Tu as lord of Zheng.

sentences.zh: 晉侯十九年，齊人管至父弒其君襄公。

translations.text: In Jin Hou Min's nineteenth year, Guan Zhi Fu of Qi assassinated his lord Duke Xiang.
In Jin Hou Min's fourth year, Song seized Ji Zhong of Zheng and established Tu as lord of Zheng. In Jin Hou Min's nineteenth year, Guan Zhi Fu of Qi assassinated his lord Duke Xiang.

sentences.zh: 晉侯二十八年，齊桓公始霸。

translations.text: In Jin Hou Min's twenty-eighth year, Duke Huan of Qi became hegemon.

sentences.zh: 曲沃武公伐晉侯緡，滅之，盡以其寶器賂獻于周釐王。

translations.text: Wu Gong of Quwo attacked Jin Hou Min, extinguished him, and completely bribed King Xi of Zhou with all his precious vessels.

sentences.zh: 釐王命曲沃武公為晉君，列為諸侯，於是盡併晉地而有之。

translations.text: King Xi commanded Wu Gong of Quwo to become lord of Jin and be ranked among the feudal lords.

In Jin Hou Min's twenty-eighth year, Duke Huan of Qi became hegemon. Wu Gong of Quwo attacked Jin Hou Min, extinguished him, and completely bribed King Xi of Zhou with all his precious vessels. King Xi commanded Wu Gong of Quwo to become lord of Jin and be ranked among the feudal lords.

sentences.zh: 曲沃武公已即位三十七年矣，更號曰晉武公。

translations.text: Wu Gong of Quwo had already been on the throne for thirty-seven years, but changed his title to Wu Gong of Jin.

sentences.zh: 晉武公始都晉國，前即位曲沃，通年三十八年。

translations.text: Wu Gong of Jin made Jiang his capital, though he had originally ascended at Quwo, and the total years came to thirty-eight.

Wu Gong of Quwo had already been on the throne for thirty-seven years, but changed his title to Wu Gong of Jin. Wu Gong of Jin made Jiang his capital, though he had originally ascended at Quwo, and the total years came to thirty-eight.

sentences.zh: 武公稱者，先晉穆侯曾孫也，曲沃桓叔孫也。

translations.text: Wu Gong surnamed this: he was the great-grandson of Jin Mu Hou, and grandson of Huan Shu.

sentences.zh: 桓叔者，始封曲沃。

translations.text: Huan Shu was the first to be enfeoffed at Quwo.

sentences.zh: 武公，莊伯子也。

translations.text: Wu Gong was Zhuang Bo's son.

sentences.zh: 自桓叔初封曲沃以至武公滅晉也，凡六十七歲，而卒代晉為諸侯。

translations.text: From Huan Shu's first enfeoffment at Quwo until Wu Gong extinguished Jin, sixty-seven years passed, and finally he replaced Jin to become a feudal lord.

sentences.zh: 武公代晉二歲，卒。

translations.text: Wu Gong replaced Jin after two years, then died.

sentences.zh: 與曲沃通年，即位凡三十九年而卒。

translations.text: Counting the years at Quwo, he had reigned thirty-nine years in total when he died.

sentences.zh: 子獻公詭諸立。

translations.text: His son Xian Gong Gui Zhu succeeded him.

Wu Gong surnamed this: he was the great-grandson of Jin Mu Hou, and grandson of Huan Shu. Huan Shu was the first to be enfeoffed at Quwo. Wu Gong was Zhuang Bo's son. From Huan Shu's first enfeoffment at Quwo until Wu Gong extinguished Jin, sixty-seven years passed, and finally he replaced Jin to become a feudal lord. Wu Gong replaced Jin after two years, then died. Counting the years at Quwo, he had reigned thirty-nine years in total when he died. His son Xian Gong Gui Zhu succeeded him.

sentences.zh: 獻公元年，周惠王弟穨攻惠王，惠王出奔，居鄭之櫟邑。

translations.text: In Xian Gong's first year, King Hui of Zhou's younger brother attacked King Hui, who fled and resided in the Li district of Zheng.
In Xian Gong's first year, King Hui of Zhou's younger brother attacked King Hui, who fled and resided in the Li district of Zheng.

sentences.zh: 五年，伐驪戎，得驪姬、驪姬弟，俱愛幸之。

translations.text: In the fifth year, he attacked the Lirong and obtained Li Ji and her younger brother, both of whom he loved and favored.
In the fifth year, he attacked the Lirong and obtained Li Ji and her younger brother, both of whom he loved and favored.

sentences.zh: 八年，士蒍說公曰：「故晉之群公子多，不誅，亂且起。」

translations.text: In the eighth year, Shi Kui advised the duke: 'The former duke had many sons from the various houses, but if they are not eliminated, disorder will surely arise.'

sentences.zh: 乃使盡殺諸公子，而城聚都之，命曰絳，始都絳。

translations.text: Therefore he had all the various princes killed, walled and gathered Jiang as the capital, and named it Jiang, beginning to make Jiang his capital.

sentences.zh: 九年，晉群公子既亡奔虢，虢以其故再伐晉，弗克。

translations.text: In the ninth year, the various Jin princes had fled and taken refuge in Guo, so Guo attacked Jin twice on their account, but was unsuccessful.

sentences.zh: 十年，晉欲伐虢，士蒍曰：「且待其亂。」

translations.text: In the tenth year, Jin wished to attack Guo, but Shi Kui said: 'Wait for their internal disorder.'

Therefore he had all the various princes killed, walled and gathered Jiang as the capital, and named it Jiang, beginning to make Jiang his capital. In the ninth year, the various Jin princes had fled and taken refuge in Guo, so Guo attacked Jin twice on their account, but was unsuccessful. In the tenth year, Jin wished to attack Guo, but Shi Kui said: 'Wait for their internal disorder.'

sentences.zh: 十二年，驪姬生奚齊。

translations.text: In the twelfth year, Li Ji gave birth to Xi Qi.

sentences.zh: 獻公有意廢太子，乃曰：「曲沃吾先祖宗廟所在，而蒲邊秦，屈邊翟，不使諸子居之，我懼焉。」

translations.text: Xian Gong had thoughts of abolishing the crown prince, so he said: 'Quwo is my ancestral temple location, and Pu borders Qin while Qu borders the Di - I cannot let my various sons reside there, for I fear them.'

sentences.zh: 於是使太子申生居曲沃，公子重耳居蒲，公子夷吾居屈。

translations.text: Therefore he sent the crown prince Shen Sheng to reside at Quwo, Prince Chong Er at Pu, and Prince Yi Wu at Qu.

sentences.zh: 獻公與驪姬子奚齊居絳。
